channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: Hmmm. Possible Valentine’s Day gift for my Beloved Conservative Relative. https://t.co/ndTihnlK3Y

item.description: @NathanJRobinson That’s one way to save on comp copies to dedicatees.

item.description: @WendellSherk @Bamer1can @AkivaMCohen I think the judge knew he was writing for the broad political argument. Note that having demolished the constitutionality of the law, he gave a graphic example of its malign stupidity on the very last page.
item.source:markdown: @WendellSherk @Bamer1can @AkivaMCohen I think the judge knew he was writing for the broad political argument. Note that having demolished the constitutionality of the law, he gave a graphic example of its malign stupidity on the very last page.

item.description:
A delightful federal court ruling, which along the way points out the danger Republican anti-“woke” activism, as embodied by the unconstitutional DeSantis law at issue, is bad for Holocaust education. https://t.co/Zd7q5pTxEp

Also warns that Finnegan’s Wake is unconstitutionally vague.
item.source:markdown:
A delightful federal court ruling, which along the way points out the danger Republican anti-“woke” activism, as embodied by the unconstitutional DeSantis law at issue, is bad for Holocaust education. https://t.co/Zd7q5pTxEp
Also warns that Finnegan’s Wake is unconstitutionally vague.

item.description: @AkivaMCohen A delightful read. Is this the first time that Joyce has been declared unconstitutionally vague?

item.description: What other army would arrest a human rights worker to ensure Jews could worship freely (on someone else’s land) on Tisha b’Av? מי כעמך ישראל! https://t.co/GuSdGs8bAL
item.source:markdown: What other army would arrest a human rights worker to ensure Jews could worship freely (on someone else’s land) on Tisha b’Av? מי כעמך ישראל! https://t.co/GuSdGs8bAL

item.description:
@RebeccaJShapiro I’m just cranky because I received a submission from a self-proclaimed Newsmax/Times of Israel “science correspondent” that included the attached gem, which was the crux of his argument. https://t.co/cZ0tsJzs0b

@RebeccaJShapiro People are working very hard to lay the groundwork for something very ugly here.
item.source:markdown:
@RebeccaJShapiro I’m just cranky because I received a submission from a self-proclaimed Newsmax/Times of Israel “science correspondent” that included the attached gem, which was the crux of his argument. https://t.co/cZ0tsJzs0b
@RebeccaJShapiro People are working very hard to lay the groundwork for something very ugly here.

item.description: @trekonomics @AHAhistorians Amazingly enough, there was no actual science in the submission. Just culture war craziness.

item.description:
@gilibugg You can’t tell on the English stickers!

@gilibugg As for the Hebrew: They had one Job….

item.description: @trekonomics @AHAhistorians Maybe she can use the time saved to do communications outreach to the self-described “science columnist” for Newsmax and Times of Israel who submitted an essay to my paper with the attached. https://t.co/LlwrqAk7qu

item.description: @dylanotes What movies shaped his ahistorical image of German generals? I’ve started to wonder whether all the WWII movies that generation watched on endless reruns exposed them to a morally fatal dose of Nazi propaganda.
item.source:markdown: @dylanotes What movies shaped his ahistorical image of German generals? I’ve started to wonder whether all the WWII movies that generation watched on endless reruns exposed them to a morally fatal dose of Nazi propaganda.

item.description: @melnickjeffrey1 @ADL Personally, I’d prefer a posthumous conviction after dying a free man to a posthumous pardon after being lynched.
item.source:markdown: @melnickjeffrey1 @ADL Personally, I’d prefer a posthumous conviction after dying a free man to a posthumous pardon after being lynched.

item.description: @drvolts How are Christians not embarrassed?
